result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Zachary Berst

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant John Zachary Berst in court and by Attorney Daniel R. Skarie.  Defense requests the defendant to be referred to OCRP.  Counsel stipulate to a referral the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.  Court finds the defendant is incompetent at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court does not make any findings as to the administration of medication at this time.  Court orders proceeding suspended and commits defendant to Department of Health Services. Court further orders defendant be referred to the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.
Review scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Review scheduled for April 19, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Review scheduled for July 19, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Review scheduled for September 19, 2023 at 08:00 am.

District Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Zachary Berst in court and by Attorney Daniel R. Skarie.  Discussion regarding competency findings and recommendations.  Defense objects to inpatient treatment and requests a hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Competency hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
References report from Dr Goebel filed 8-31-22. Includes Milwaukee Co & Ozaukee Co case numbers.
from Dr Goebel; Confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed 8-31-22. Includes Milwaukee Co & Ozaukee Co case numbers.
22R 015924 Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Zachary Berst appears in custody via video and by Attorney Daniel R. Skarie via video.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defense raises issue of competency.  Court orders competency evaluation.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Zachary Berst appeared by video, in custody in WC Jail.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie makes special appearance by video for John Zachary Berst.  (22CF345 Br. 3; Milwaukee Co. 22CF328; Ozaukee Co. 22CF30)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant waives in person appearance.  Atty. Skarie states will meet with the defendant and unsure if will be retained on this case.  State requests $5,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Skarie requests $2,500.00 cash bond and defendant is unlikely to post bond.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
